title: Relates to dismissal of parking violations in certain instances
summary: Provides that for notices of parking violations issued before September 1, 2012, if any information on the notice of violation is omitted, misdescribed, or illegible, the parking violation shall be dismissed upon application by the person charged; for those notices after September 1, 2011, if any information is omitted, misdescribed, or illegible, the hearing officer shall enter an order dismissing the violation.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                          402

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of A. DINOWITZ, PHEFFER, V. LOPEZ, PERRY, MILLMAN --
         Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of A. CLARK, COLTON, COOK, CYMBROWITZ, GLICK,
         MARKEY, McENENY, SCARBOROUGH -- read once and referred to the  Commit-
         tee on Transportation

       AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to adjudication
         of certain parking infractions

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Paragraph (b) of subdivision 2-a  of  section  238  of  the
    2  vehicle and traffic law, as added by chapter 224 of the laws of 1995, is
    3  amended to read as follows:
    4    (b)  [If  any] FOR NOTICES OF VIOLATION ISSUED BEFORE SEPTEMBER FIRST,
    5  TWO THOUSAND TWELVE, IF ANY information which is required to be inserted
    6  on a notice of violation  is  omitted  from  the  notice  of  violation,
    7  misdescribed, or illegible, the violation shall be dismissed upon appli-
    8  cation  of  the  person  charged  with  the  violation.  FOR  NOTICES OF
    9  VIOLATION ISSUED ON OR AFTER SEPTEMBER FIRST, TWO  THOUSAND  TWELVE,  IF
   10  ANY  INFORMATION  WHICH  IS  REQUIRED  TO  BE  INSERTED  ON  A NOTICE OF
   11  VIOLATION IS OMITTED FROM THE  NOTICE  OF  VIOLATION,  MISDESCRIBED,  OR
   12  ILLEGIBLE,  THE  HEARING  OFFICER  SHALL  ENTER  AN ORDER DISMISSING THE
   13  VIOLATION.
   14    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.



        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD04364-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to adjudication of certain parking infractions
